image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old woman has died at Royal Darwin Hospital 10 days after an alleged domestic violence attack. A man has been charged as police continue to investigate.

title.children: 22yo woman dies in Darwin hospital after alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: A man's eye illuminated by a light.

props.synopsis: In the Top End, cataracts often go untreated for years, becoming dense and leathery. A roving surgery team is tackling the backlog and restoring sight to remote Indigenous patients.

title.children: Life-changing cataract surgery restores eyesight to hunt again

image.altText: A man with a beanie and goatee holding a bass guitar

props.synopsis: Since first picking up a guitar as a teenager, James Mangohig has gone on to collaborate with stars like Jessica Mauboy and win an ARIA award with fellow Northern Territory artist Emily Wurramara.

title.children: Darwin's 'melting pot' key to success for award-winning music producer

image.altText: A crowd of people sit on the ground with candles and a sign with the red, black and yellow indigenous flag.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old Yuendumu man died last week after being restrained by police officers on a supermarket floor following an altercation.

title.children: Crowds attend Sydney vigil for young Warlpiri man's death in custody

image.altText: A man dressed in orange stands on the bow of a police boat in the water

props.synopsis: Police say the man "voluntarily" jumped from the bridge with workmates on Friday night and was last seen "in the middle of the channel, drifting toward Darwin City in strong tidal currents".

title.children: Man last seen 'laughing and active' after jumping from NT bridge found dead

image.altText: A young girl lies with her head down in front of flower tributes.

props.synopsis: In the shadow of the Kumanjayi Walker inquest, a number of similarities with this week's death in Alice Springs stand out — and not just the fact both men came from the same remote community.

title.children: Young Warlpiri man's death raises uncomfortable questions for us all

image.altText: A woman with curly red hair sits on an outdoor bench smiling lightly.

props.synopsis: BreastScreen Australia now says routine mammograms should include breast density reports but currently only those in New South Wales, Victoria, South Australia and Western Australia do so.

title.children: 'I had no idea': Not every mammogram includes a breast density report

image.altText: A close up of a Filipino man's face as he wears a leather wide brim hat and a grey/beige button-up shirt. Green background blur

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is the only jurisdiction in Australia where Filipinos are the number one migrant group. Those in the tight-knit community share why they love life in the Top End.

title.children: Why so many Filipinos choose to call the NT home

image.altText: A woman and a teenager sit on the couch looking at a phone.

props.synopsis: After migrating to Australia, Wing Siu thought her daughter was going through a silent struggle to adjust to a new culture. But the move hid a more complex and sometimes "taboo" reality.

title.children: ‘We were shocked’: Why migrant families misread kids’ ‘naughty’ behaviour

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: National house prices have continued rising amid interest rate cuts and expectations are that as more buyers return to the market, property values could rise by up to 10 per cent by early 2026.

title.children: Property prices rise and tipped to lift up to 10pc by early 2026

image.altText: Prison officers

props.synopsis: Exclusive data obtained by 7.30 reveals the extent of lockdowns inside the maximum security Dame Phyllis Frost Centre, and it's leading to a disturbing spike in self-harm.

title.children: Prisoners left with no meals for days inside Victoria's shocking prison system

image.altText: A man in a black shirt holding a live abalone.

props.synopsis: Chinese-farmed abalone is flooding the Chinese market, and it is bad news for the Tasmanian industry as its premium product gets crowded out of a lucrative market.

title.children: Tasmanian abalone farms close as pressure from Chinese market bucks profits

image.altText: A medical worker in full PPE fills a syringe with COVID-19 vaccine.

props.synopsis: As influenza cases continue to rise in the lead up to winter, a new study has found that getting a COVID-19 booster at the same time as the flu vaccination could reduce the rate of hospital admissions for both illnesses.

title.children: Getting COVID booster alongside flu shot could reduce hospitalisations, study finds

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou

props.synopsis: He has chased his impossible dream across clubs and continents. Now, Ange Postecoglou has made it real by coaching Tottenham to glory in the Europa League.

title.children: Ange breaks his silence: 'I haven't got here by accident'

image.altText: trump claps at a podium while wearing a MAGA hat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's team is fighting one of the most consequential legal cases in the US history, but there are plenty more where that came from: 250 lawsuits are currently featuring his administration.

title.children: There's a 'nasty' new nickname for Trump, but it gets something wrong

image.altText: Anthony Albanese pointing at press conference

props.synopsis: New post-election research demonstrates the Coalition is losing its long-held advantage in a key area.

title.children: More bad news for Liberals in election fallout

image.altText: Plibersek looks serious as she speaks to a camera in a corridor of parliament house.

props.synopsis: Labor minister Tanya Plibersek says the government decides how much it spends on defence in order to keep Australians safe. Follow live.

title.children: Plibersek and Joyce clash on Australia's defence spending

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AUKUS submarines a 'disgusting waste': Jacqui Lambie
Resources minister 'very confident' Albanese will meet Trump
Tanya Plibersek says Australia won't 'pick a number out of the air' for defence spending

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has edged lower after more trade war turmoil, after Wall Street closed flat after a volatile session. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slips on tariff turmoil, Soul Patts and Brickworks soar on $14b merger

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX marginally lower, Soul Patts and Brickworks soar on merger
ASX opens flat, Brickworks and Soul Patts soar
Local manufacturing softens despite export growth, inflation eases

image.altText: A corrugated tin shed covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Karen Buckner's family spent three nights in a hut during a summer blizzard in Kosciuszko National Park and says it saved their lives. After the Black Summer bushfires, some feared the high country's famous hut network might disappear forever.

title.children: A little dot on the map saved this family when a blizzard blew in

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing outside a concrete building

props.synopsis: Lauren Ingrid Flanigan was charged with murder after her daughter was found with stab wounds near Bundaberg last Monday.

title.children: Woman charged with child's murder dies after being found unresponsive

image.altText: A green flash in the night sky above traffic lights in Sydney

props.synopsis: The mysterious green flash ripped through the skies about 6pm last night.

title.children: 'Basketball-sized' meteor lights up Sydney sky

image.altText: GettyImages-2218130415

props.synopsis: The peloton rides through the Vatican as Simon Yates finally claims the Giro d'Italia after years of close calls.

title.children: Pope blesses the peloton as Brit claims historic Giro d'Italia victory

image.altText: Liz Bonner at work 4

props.synopsis: Advocates claim that 'menopause-friendly' employers increase productivity and create a better culture, but only four Australian workplaces are officially accredited as menopause-friendly.

title.children: How to make workplaces more menopause-friendly

image.altText: GettyImages-2217490779

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has won the Formula 1 Spanish Grand Prix from pole position, while world champion Max Verstappen had a moment of fury and appeared to crash into a rival.

title.children: Piastri wins again, as F1 champ calls for Verstappen disqualification over crash

image.altText: A man stands in the bottom of a large washout near water after fast moving flooding.

props.synopsis: The sheer velocity and volume of the floodwater washed away up to 40 centimetres of topsoil, along with fencing, roads and livestock.

title.children: Floodwater strips away topsoil leaving paddocks bare in western Qld

image.altText: A group of football players wearing red and black armbands

props.synopsis: Football players across Victoria don red armbands in protest over the axing of the Office of Women in Sport and Recreation.

title.children: Red armbands worn across football fields in silent protest over cuts

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds a smartphone as he takes a selfie with members of the public and Parramatta MP Andrew Charlton

props.synopsis: Some in Western Sydney say they feel ignored by the major parties, and only "cared about during election cycles".

title.children: Inside Labor's 'lucky escape' in Western Sydney

image.altText: GettyImages-2218129270

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz hands a point to opponent Ben Shelton after admitting his hands came off his racquet during a rally.

title.children: Alcaraz applauded for sportsmanship after handing Shelton a point

image.altText: Sarah Jessica Parker playfully swings a sparkly handbag on a street corner.

props.synopsis: Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte, Seema and LTW are back in season three of this Sex and the City spin-off, and their friendship is back, front and centre.

title.children: The Sex and the City spin-off keeps getting better and better

image.altText: A child holding paper cups over a wind contraption.

props.synopsis: Questacon's ZAP! CLANK! POW! uses a comic book theme to link 17 interactive displays on electricity, machines and motion, including some old favourites from the past 37 years.

title.children: Questacon classics brought together in new hands-on exhibition

image.altText: Blue algae glow on the coastline

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian scientist says multiple marine events in her state suggests the environment is under stress, and there's a critical need to reduce pollution to alleviate some pressure.

title.children: Why south-east Tassie has suffered a succession of major marine events

image.altText: Peter and Barbara Rye roller skating

props.synopsis: When Peter and Barbara Rye get into their rollerskates, they move in a kind of unison that only comes after five decades of marriage — three of them on wheels.

title.children: Married for five decades, Peter and Barbara keep rolling back the years

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin plays a double-fisted backhand.

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin finds no way through Tommy Paul, as the Australian men's challenge at the French Open comes to an end in the Roland-Garros sunshine.

title.children: Popyrin bows out tamely at French Open
